Hello. My name is Maria and I have been an animal caretaker and rescuer since I was very young.
I have been running a non profit horse (and sometimes dog and cat) sanctuary on the Osa Peninsula, Costa Rica solo for over the last ten years.

I am currently fundraising to cover monthly costs of hay, feed and farm costs for 15 horses and ponies as our current location does not have enough pasture and we are in rainy season which means zero tourism.

For those who knew her, they knew that Erika’s heart belonged to the animals. She was a dedicated volunteer and fierce advocate for dogs and creatures of all kinds. Her mission was simple: to ensure that every animal in the shelter received the utmost care and affection.

To celebrate her life and continue her compassionate work, we are raising funds for her cherished animal shelter.

Erika’s passion was hands-on: she believed every dog should be treated with dignity and love.

Hi everyone,
It’s hard to even find the words right now. Our sweet girl Tiger Lily passed away today, and we are completely devastated.

She stopped eating and started getting sick out of nowhere, but we were so hopeful. We were willing to do whatever it took to save her. Because of the way it’s wrapped around her leg, the tumor can’t be safely removed. Fortunately, it’s a slow-spreading cancer, and our vets believe that it can be treated by amputating the leg itself.

We rushed him to the emergency vet after noticing swelling in his eye, where he was immediately treated for an eye ulcer. Just two days later, we returned home only to discover his condition had worsened — his eye had ruptured.

For 25 years, I've called Miami's West Little River home, and for just as long, my heart has ached for the countless stray and suffering animals I've seen. When I first moved here, the streets were filled with hundreds of cats—sick, injured, and in desperate need of help. So, I started trapping, neutering, and returning them (TNR).

If you know anything about me, you know that rescuing animals has been part of my life for decades — from flying rescues out of Mexico and South Korea to fostering, nursing, feeding, and rehoming countless animals in need.

This work has always been close to my heart, but lately, it’s become more necessary than ever here in Puerto Escondido, Mexico, where the number of abandoned and suffering animals grows every day.

The Cozy Catfe Cruiser: A Mobile Cat Lounge Experience


Who am I?
Hi, I’m Briana, an animal lover and long-time volunteer at The Cozy Catfe Rescue, a nonprofit cat café in Arlington, Texas that has helped over 420 cats find their forever homes. I’ve spent years fostering, volunteering, and supporting animal rescue, and I’ve seen firsthand how powerful it is when people connect with adoptable cats outside of a shelter setting.
